Code Example Bad: <View style={{ marginTop: 80 }}><PrimaryActions /></View> /* Forces two-handed use on large phones */

Description: iOS design favors minimal shadows depth through blur and translucency and rounded corners
Do: Use subtle shadows with blur. Apply SF Symbols. Use system blur effects for depth. Rounded corners 10-20pt
Don't: Use heavy drop shadows or flat design without depth cues which feels non-native on iOS
Code Example Bad: <View style={{ elevation: 8, shadowRadius: 8 }}> /* Android-style heavy shadow on iOS */

Description: iOS uses scroll wheel pickers for date/time selection providing familiar haptic interaction pattern
Do: Use UIDatePicker wheel style or equivalent. Provide haptic feedback on scroll stops
Don't: Use calendar grid picker which feels foreign to iOS users and lacks expected haptics
Code Example Good: <DatePicker mode="date" display="spinner" /> /* iOS native wheel style */
Code Example Bad: <CalendarPicker /> /* Android-style grid on iOS feels wrong */

Description: iOS uses edge swipe for back navigation and horizontal tab bars. Respect these system patterns
Do: Implement interactivePopGestureRecognizer for back. Use TabBarController for main navigation
Don't: Disable edge swipe back or use Android-style drawer navigation which confuses iOS users
Code Example Bad: gestureRecognizer.isEnabled = false /* Breaks expected iOS back gesture */

Description: Material Design uses elevation and shadows to communicate hierarchy. Higher elevation = more importance
Do: Use elevation 1-6dp for cards 8dp for dialogs 16dp for drawers. Match Material elevation spec
Don't: Use flat design without elevation or iOS-style blur which feels non-native on Android
Code Example Good: <Card style={{ elevation: 2 }}> /* Surface */ <Modal style={{ elevation: 24 }}> /* Dialog */
Code Example Bad: <Card style={{ shadowOpacity: 0.1 }}> /* iOS shadow style on Android */

Description: Material Design uses calendar grid for date picking with clear month navigation and range selection
Do: Use MaterialDatePicker with calendar grid view. Support date range selection where appropriate
Don't: Use iOS-style scroll wheels for dates which feels foreign and lacks Material interaction patterns
Code Example Bad: <DatePicker mode="spinner" /> /* iOS wheel style on Android */

Description: Android has system back button/gesture that must be handled. Predictable back behavior is expected
Do: Handle onBackPressed consistently. Use NavController for predictable back stack
Don't: Override or ignore system back creating navigation confusion or trapping users
Code Example Bad: onBackPressed { /* do nothing */ } /* Traps user violates Android contract */

Description: Android 14+ supports predictive back gesture showing destination preview during back swipe
Do: Enable predictive back animations. Ensure all activities handle back consistently for preview
Don't: Disable predictive back or have inconsistent back handling breaking the preview experience

Description: Screen reader users navigate by swiping and need logical focus order and clear labels
Do: Implement proper accessibilityLabel for all interactive elements. Ensure logical tab/swipe order
Don't: Rely on visual-only cues or have illogical focus order that confuses VoiceOver/TalkBack users
Code Example Good: <TouchableOpacity accessibilityLabel="Submit order" accessibilityRole="button" accessibilityHint="Double tap to confirm">
Code Example Bad: <TouchableOpacity><Image source={submitIcon} /></TouchableOpacity> /* No label for screen reader */

Description: iOS Dynamic Type allows users to set preferred text size. Apps must respect this setting
Do: Use system fonts with Dynamic Type. Test at all accessibility sizes. Support up to xxxLarge
Don't: Use fixed font sizes that ignore Dynamic Type settings making text unreadable for low vision users

Description: Android allows font scaling up to 200%. Apps must handle this gracefully without breaking layout
Do: Use sp units for text. Test at max font scale. Allow text containers to grow
Don't: Use dp for text or fixed height containers that clip scaled text
Code Example Bad: android:textSize="16dp" /* Won't scale */ android:layout_height="48dp" /* May clip large text */

Description: Users with vestibular disorders enable Reduce Motion. Apps must check and respect this preference
Do: Query prefers-reduced-motion or UIAccessibility.isReduceMotionEnabled. Provide instant alternatives
Don't: Ignore reduce motion preference causing discomfort or nausea for vestibular disorder users
Code Example Good: if UIAccessibility.isReduceMotionEnabled { /* Use crossfade instead of slide */ }
Code Example Bad: UIView.animate(withDuration: 0.5) { /* Always animates regardless of setting */ }

Description: Users with motor impairments may need longer touch duration or different gesture requirements
Do: Support iOS Touch Accommodations and Android accessibility timeout. Test with Switch Control
Don't: Require precise quick taps or complex multi-finger gestures that exclude motor-impaired users
Code Example Bad: <TouchableOpacity delayLongPress={200}> /* Too fast for motor impairment */

Description: iPhone notch and home indicator require safe area handling to avoid content being obscured
Do: Use safeAreaInsets on all screens. Apply to both top (notch) and bottom (home indicator)
Don't: Ignore safe areas causing content to render behind notch or under home indicator
Code Example Bad: <View style={{ flex: 1 }}><Content /></View> /* Content hidden behind notch */

Description: Android devices have various cutout shapes (notch punch-hole) requiring display cutout handling
Do: Use WindowInsets API. Set android:windowLayoutInDisplayCutoutMode in theme
Don't: Ignore display cutouts causing content to render behind camera or sensor housing
Code Example Bad: /* No inset handling - content behind cutout */

Description: Bottom CTAs must account for home indicator/gesture bar to remain fully visible and tappable
Do: Add safe area padding to bottom fixed elements. Ensure CTA is above gesture area
Don't: Place CTAs that overlap with gesture bar causing accidental home triggers or hidden buttons
Code Example Bad: <View style={{ position: 'absolute', bottom: 0 }}><Button>Checkout</Button></View> /* Overlaps gesture bar */

Description: Landscape orientation has safe areas on sides for notch and may have keyboard avoidance needs
Do: Handle left/right safe area insets in landscape. Test both landscape orientations
Don't: Only handle portrait safe areas causing landscape layout issues with notch on side
Code Example Good: <View style={{ paddingLeft: insets.left, paddingRight: insets.right }}> /* Landscape safe */
Code Example Bad: <View style={{ paddingTop: insets.top }}> /* Ignores landscape side insets */

Description: Virtual keyboard can obscure input fields. Content must shift to keep focused field visible
Do: Use KeyboardAvoidingView or android:windowSoftInputMode. Scroll focused input into view
Don't: Let keyboard cover input fields requiring user to dismiss keyboard to see what they typed

Description: iOS users expect swipe-to-reveal actions on list items particularly swipe-left for delete
Do: Implement leading/trailing swipe actions. Use red for destructive and system colors for others
Don't: Use long-press menus only or Android-style checkbox selection for delete on iOS

Description: Pull-to-refresh is expected for refreshable content lists. Animation should indicate loading state
Do: Implement RefreshControl with loading spinner. Place at list top. Provide haptic on activation
Don't: Omit pull-to-refresh on refreshable lists or place refresh button elsewhere confusing users

Description: Image and map content should support pinch-to-zoom for detail inspection. Respect zoom limits
Do: Enable pinch zoom with min/max scale limits. Support double-tap to zoom. Show zoom indicator
Don't: Disable zoom on zoomable content or allow infinite zoom causing performance issues
Code Example Good: <Image resizeMode="contain" style={{ transform: [{ scale: zoomScale }] }} /* With gesture handler */
Code Example Bad: <Image resizeMode="cover" /> /* No zoom capability on detail images */

Description: Edge swipe gestures conflict with system navigation. Avoid custom edge gestures near screen edges
Do: Keep custom gestures away from screen edges (20pt margin). Let system handle edge gestures
Don't: Implement custom edge swipes that conflict with iOS back gesture or Android edge navigation
Code Example Bad: <GestureDetector hitSlop={{ left: 0 }}> /* Conflicts with system back gesture */

Description: Haptic feedback confirms gestures and actions. Use appropriate feedback intensity for context
Do: Use light haptic for selections medium for confirmations heavy for errors. Match system patterns
Don't: Overuse haptics or use wrong intensity creating annoying or confusing feedback

Description: Users should be able to cancel gestures by moving finger away before release
Do: Allow gesture cancellation by dragging outside hit area. Show visual feedback during drag
Don't: Commit action immediately on gesture start with no way to cancel accidental touches
Code Example Good: <Pressable onPressIn={highlight} onPressOut={unhighlight} onPress={performAction}> /* Can cancel by dragging out */

Description: Long press duration should balance quick access with accidental trigger prevention
Do: Use 500ms for long press (iOS default). Show visual feedback during press buildup
Don't: Use very short (<300ms) or very long (>800ms) long press that triggers accidentally or feels unresponsive

Description: Complex multi-finger gestures should be optional with single-finger alternatives available
Do: Provide single-finger alternatives for all multi-touch gestures. Multi-touch as shortcut only
Don't: Require multi-finger gestures for essential features excluding users with motor impairments
Code Example Good: /* Two-finger zoom OR double-tap zoom OR zoom buttons */ <ZoomControls showButtons={true} enablePinch={true} enableDoubleTap={true}>
Code Example Bad: <PinchableView> /* Only pinch zoom - excludes users who can't multi-touch */
